page.title: 05Local Annual Events
page.content: We have a fair number of events in Chorleywood like school fetes, May Fairs and a Donkey Derby. Nearly every school in the area has a school fete every year. They are normally on a Saturday in July. Sometimes they clash like this year in which I know of three schools which had their fetes on the same day. Then there is the May Fair Clement Danes hold which is now quite a big occasion. It has stalls,games, sideshows and fun things. Lastly the Donkey Derby. This is always held on the 2nd Saturday of June. It normally raises lots of money for charities and this year raised three and a half thousand pounds for different charities. This year most of the money went to buy a special orthopedic bed for people with bad burns and the remainder will go to the Ethiopia and Sudan famine appeals.
